title: Account Manager II
description:
About Acrisure:
Acrisure is a global Fintech leader that combines the best of humans and high tech to offer multiple financial products and services to millions of businesses and individual clients. We connect clients to solutions that help them protect and grow what matters, including Insurance, Reinsurance, Cyber Services, Mortgage Origination and more.
Acrisure employs over 17,000 entrepreneurial colleagues in 21 countries and have grown from $38 million to $4.3 billion in revenue in just over ten years. Our culture is defined by our entrepreneurial spirit and all that comes with it: innovation, client centricity and an indomitable will to win.
Job Summary:
Staff Benefits Management & Administrators (SBMA), a third-party administrator, is an affordable ACA-compliant benefits provider to thousands of employers. Their goal is to simplify the complexity of providing employee benefits. SBMA is different because of its personal service, speed of implementation, and innovative approach to benefits coverage.  

SBMA, a third-party administrator, is currently seeking an Account Manager II to join our growing team. The Account Manager II will be responsible for a number of daily administrative tasks. Qualified candidates will possess the ability to pay attention to detail, self-motivation, outstanding customer service (verbal and written), learn and use new computer systems and software, and work well in collaborative environments.
Account Manager II Essential Duties and Responsibilities:* Demonstrate articulate, polite, and tactful communication both verbally and in writing. Engage with clients and team members professionally to facilitate smooth interactions and resolve issues.
* Proficient knowledge and ability to use advanced features of Excel, Outlook, and Microsoft Office Suite to manage data, generate reports, and streamline office operations. This includes creating and maintaining, producing, and cleaning up complex spreadsheets.
* Handle inbound calls promptly and direct them to the appropriate department or individual.
* Provide accurate and helpful information to clients and serve as the main point of contact, ensuring their needs are addressed efficiently.
* Address and resolve client inquiries and issues related to policies, benefits, and coverage. Provide guidance and solutions based on a thorough understanding of company products and services.
* Oversee and manage a high-volume inbox for a book of 50+ group accounts. Prioritize, organize, and respond to emails related to various client needs, policy updates, and administrative tasks.
* Cultivate and enhance relationships with existing clients to ensure their continued satisfaction and loyalty.
* Develop and implement strategic plans to effectively manage and grow a book of business. This involves analyzing account performance, identifying opportunities for improvement, and maintaining strong client relationships.
* Process and handle requests for new or replacement ID cards solely for the assigned book of business. Ensure requests are completed accurately and promptly and communicate with clients regarding the status of their requests.
* Execute daily administrative tasks, including managing Outlook inbox, managing portals related to the book of business, scheduling meetings with internal or external contacts, ensuring all policy documentation is accurate, complete, and up to date, and maintaining organized records. This involves efficient task prioritization and attention to detail.
* Demonstrate strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Prioritize daily responsibilities to meet deadlines and maintain high productivity levels.
* Contribute positively to team dynamics by working cooperatively with colleagues. Support team initiatives and participate in collaborative projects to achieve common goals.
* Participate in internal training sessions and professional development programs to enhance skills and knowledge.
* Possess a Health and Life Insurance License or be willing to obtain one within six months of employment. This certification is essential for providing accurate information and handling insurance-related transactions.
* Minimum of (3) years of experience in the insurance industry, including direct experience with medical benefits or direct insurance-related experience. Familiarity with benefit/eligibility portals is preferred.
* Ability to work independently in a remote environment while maintaining high productivity and meeting performance expectations.
* Overall account group oversight by managing all aspects related to employer-based/Self-Funded insurance plans. This includes coordinating with Group Admins, Brokers, and General Agencies, addressing group-specific issues, and ensuring comprehensive management of each account.

*This description is not meant to be all-inclusive and may be modified from time to time at the discretion of management.*
Competencies:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to satisfactorily perform each essential duty. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
Education and Experience:* 3+ Years of prior insurance experience, required
* A high school diploma or the recognized equivalent, required
* 3+ years of prior medical benefits-related insurance experience required
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (intermediate to advanced Excel knowledge)
* 3+ years of prior experience working in an administrative/office setting


Other Qualifications:* Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to work well independently on assigned duties and collaborate effectively with a team
* Must be comfortable with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.)
* Bilingual, not required, but a plus.


Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.* Moderate stress due to regular deadlines and daily challenges
* High finger dexterity while typing documents and forms
* Occasionally lift up to 20 lbs.


Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. California residents can learn more about our privacy practices for applicants by visiting the Acrisure California Applicant Privacy Policy available at www.Acrisure.com/privacy/caapplicant.  

To Executive Search Firms & Staffing Agencies: Acrisure does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies that have not signed a mutual service agreement. All unsolicited resumes will be considered Acrisure’s property, and Acrisure will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting Acrisure’s Human Resources Talent Department.

title: Director Vet Ops CA Dermatology – Global Medical Affairs (GMA)
description:
Role Description
Position Summary:
The Zoetis Global Medical Affairs team is recruiting a board-certified veterinary dermatologist to provide best in-class veterinary medical leadership for the Zoetis dermatology portfolio. This role will work across global markets and work alongside above market teams and other commercial and operational functions to develop strategic plans to ensure our scientific activities create and deliver unparalleled value to our customers and therefore become a major differentiator, create competitive advantage and contribute to the growth objectives of Zoetis’ Companion Animal (CA) Dermatology category. The veterinary dermatologist will drive excellence in dermatology across the business and ensure delivery of short-, medium-, and long-term medical support plans in International Operations to meet identified objectives for market development and differentiation of the solutions offered by Zoetis in close alignment with medical and marketing teams across the globe.
Position Responsibilities:
Set ambition and annual, mid to long-term vision for veterinary support solutions in the area of CA Dermatology globally in close cooperation with other commercial colleagues. 30%
Maintain strong operational relationships with veterinary teams in market to ensure that market knowledge is continuously being developed and up to date, developing frameworks and processes for alignment across markets. 20%
Plan, implement and coordinate above-market KOL management plans (incl. clinical activities and study grants) for category 15%
Lead global representation and messaging strategy to external scientific and clinical stakeholders (e.g. universities) and at global and regional congresses/fairs 15%
Contribute to content marketing asset development.10%
Lead development of training on technical excellence applicable to category.10%
Organizational Relationships:
Internal:* All members of the Global Medical Affairs team
* Category Management Lead CA Dermatology at the International Center of Excellence
* Medical leads in dermatology in the US
* Cluster Leads, country VPs/GM’s, in market veterinary leadership
* Other members of the International and US Operations Center Team
* Global Functions, i.e. VMRD, GCD, ZTD and AGB teams


External:* KOL’s globally
* Regulatory authorities and AH trade associations
* Experts in similar areas within the animal health industry


Resources Managed:
Financial Accountability
Indicate the Average Budget or Revenue accountability, as applicable.
As per annual budget
Ensure ongoing tracking and planning of projects and T&E
Supervision
Indicate the typical number of Colleagues managed. Include direct & indirect reports, matrix responsibility and or additional resources (i.e. contingent workers), as applicable.
Matrix responsibility – leading internal veterinary colleague networks
Education/Experience/Capabilities:
Level of education and qualification:* Doctorate in Veterinary Medicine (DVM/VMD or equivalent degree) required
* Diplomate, American College of Veterinary Dermatology or European College of Veterinary Dermatology


Professional experience/capabilities:* Practical experience as a clinical veterinary dermatologist (min. 5 years)
* Medical marketing of veterinary products to companion animal veterinarians
* Extensive capabilities proven in senior medical marketing role strategic or operationally with extensive medical leadership capabilities gained in highly matrixed organizations.
* Experience leading large scale complex projects and managing / influencing teams in diverse locations.
* Operating budget management skills
* Experience working with, leading or influencing cross-functional teams in developing and executing technical strategies, programs and/or tactics.
* Proven track-record of leading teams through transformation and having instilled a strong culture of performance and enthusiasm, even in difficult times.
* Demonstrated track-record of operational excellence with a sharp sense of vision that translates into an ability to identify new opportunities
* Experience in managing relations with a wide diversity of stakeholders including (but not limited to) medical leaders, Enabling and Global functions, customers and senior leaders
* Other specific know-how: Good knowledge of Word, Excel, Power point. Basics of clinical studies conduct and evaluation of scientific publications.
* Languages: Fluency in spoken and written English are a must, mastering other languages is a plus.


Technical Skills and Requirements:* Lead without authority.
* Ability to simplify highly technical issues.
* Demonstrates ability to own the technical CA Dermatology space: anticipates new customer needs and technical/scientific trends in the category. Eager to permanently keep up to date with the latest scientific information in the category and to transfer knowledge.
* Ability to influence leadership and to obtain buy-in and credibility.
* Capability to influence KOL’s.
* Logical and pragmatic thinker
* Good analytical skills
* Excellent communication (‘teacher’) skills; strong verbal and written presentation skills


Physical Position Requirements:* Ability to travel: 25-30%
* Weekend work occasionally for industry events


Full time
Regular
Colleague
Any unsolicited resumes sent to Zoetis from a third party, such as an Agency recruiter, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Zoetis mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Zoetis employees, or to Zoetis resume database will be considered Zoetis property. Zoetis will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.
Zoetis will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. This includes any Agency that is an approved/engaged vendor but does not have the appropriate approvals to be engaged on a search.

title: Beauty Counter Manager - Men's Fragrances - The Mall at Short Hills
description:
### **Job Description**


The ideal Men’s Fragrance Counter Manager candidate is results oriented, a team leader and thrives in a commissioned sales environment. If you share our love for the customers we serve, the merchandise we sell and the work we do, this is a place for you to build a rewarding career.

**A day in the life…**

* Set and achieve personal sales goals while supporting the goals of the team
* Set and achieve sales goals, for both in-store and digital selling with effective use of selling tools (inclusive of text and social media)
* Greet customers in a timely, professional and engaging manner
* Provide honest and confident feedback to customers regarding men’s grooming and fragrance products
* Build lasting relationships with customers by contacting them to follow up on purchases, suggest new products and invite them to upcoming events
* Consistently seek new trend and product knowledge to act as an expert for the customer
* Open new Nordstrom Rewards™ accounts as a means of building customer relationships
* Build and maintain strong vendor relationships to maximize business results
* Manage the scheduling and execution of vendor events and promotions
* Communicate business opportunities that include line performance, stock levels and team motivation/recognition
* Perform daily department maintenance tasks including stock work, re-merchandising, display, price markdowns, merchandise transfers and light cleaning

**You own this if you have…**

* Have a high school diploma, or equivalent (preferred)
* Proven ability to set and achieve sales goals
* Competitive drive and entrepreneurial confidence to succeed in a commission-based environment
* Demonstrated ability to develop relationships with customers and coworkers
* Knowledgeable and enthusiastic about cosmetic trends
* Ability to positively and proactively handle customer concerns and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to quickly learn new procedures and processes
* Strong organizational and follow-through skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* High level of ownership, accountability and initiative

**We’ve got you covered…**


Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

* Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
* Life Insurance and Disability
* Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources


A few more important points...


The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.


Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.


Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.

title: Referral Specialist
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Referral Specialist is responsible for supporting the continuity of care for clients by ensuring timely and accurate collection of necessary documentation from families and providers. This role involves coordinating with both internal teams and external providers to facilitate the seamless processing of continued care and authorizations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Document Collection**:
* Communicate with families and/or medical providers to gather required documentation for service continuity.
* Ensure all collected documents are complete and accurate per insurance requirement guidelines.
* **Provider Outreach**:
* Contact healthcare providers to request updated documentation and signatures on necessary forms.
* Follow up with providers to ensure timely receipt of requested documents by authorizations deadline.
* **Collaboration**:
* Work closely with internal departments and teams to identify and obtain needed documentation for clients receiving services.
* Coordinate with the Payor Acceptance team and Authorizations team to ensure all necessary paperwork is in place for authorization approval.
* **Data Management**:
* Maintain organized records of all collected documents and communications.
* Update client files and systems with new and updated information as received.
* **Customer Service**:
* Provide excellent customer service to families and providers, addressing any questions or concerns regarding documentation needs.
* Assist in resolving any issues or delays related to documentation collection.
* Address client concerns as they arise.
* **Compliance**:
* Track when new documentation is required and when expiration dates are coming up for documentation on file.
* Ensure all documentation complies with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
* Stay informed of any changes in documentation requirements and communicate updates to relevant parties.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent prior experience.
* Experience in a healthcare, admissions, social work, or administrative role, preferably within a similar setting.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively with a team and independently complete assigned work.
* Proficiency in Microsoft excel, word, teams and outlook
* Experience with electronic health records or similar systems.

Reports To:

* Director of Intake and Authorizations

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Laboratory Support Assistant I
description:
MPL Laboratories is seeking a **Laboratory Support Assistant I** in **Sparta, NJ**. This a laboratory support position reporting to the Assistant Group Leader of Laboratory Services. Ideal candidate will prepare, clean, and maintain the laboratory.

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**  
Prepare media using the media work instructions  
Assist with autoclave validations  
Sanitize controlled environment rooms  
Perform all phases of glassware washing to include loading and operating laboratory dishwashers and manually washing dishware  
Assist with all phases of media sterilization to include autoclave loading and operation (if over age 18)  
Conduct end-of -day Spor Klenz RTU spraying of laboratory areas  
Report low inventory of supplies to the Group Leader of Lab Services  
Clean autoclaves, stove tops and bench tops  
Perform all phases of waste disposal to include removing garbage, samples, broth and plate disposal  
Remove expired laboratory stock and equipment according to established disposal procedures  
Perform all phases of quality assurance and quality control of record keeping including entering scientific, incubating and recording data and test results into log books on a daily basis  
File quality assurance and quality control information in accordance with established procedures  
Operate laboratory equipment to include balances, dispensers and pH meters  
Ensure cleanliness of laboratory equipment  
Monitor functioning of laboratory equipment, and notify the Operations Manager of needed repairs, maintenance, calibration and validation  
Adhere to all approved safety standards to include wearing approved clothing and personal protective equipment  
Lift and carry boxes of water, petri dishes and general laboratory equipment throughout laboratory and at client locations  
Move new shipments of boxed water  
Read and follow standard operating procedures  
Clean carts and return them to Lab 1 and Lab 2

**Requirements:**   
High School diploma or equivalent required  
Associates Degree/certification in related scientific/medical program a plus  
Microbiology laboratory experience a plus  
Candidate must be able to distinguish colors in order to perform analysis  
Must have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal  
Must have math aptitude for calculations  
Must have good data entry and computer skills  
Must be able to work independently and with a team  
Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds  
Must be able to work well under pressure and meet deadlines  
Must be able to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment  
Background Check Required

**Available Shift:**  
Monday to Friday 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

For consideration all applicants must apply through our company website:  
https://phf.tbe.taleo.net/phf02/ats/careers/v2/viewRequisition?org=EMSL&cws=40&rid=4035

EMSL offers full time benefits: medical, dental, 401(k), voluntary benefits, paid time off, holiday pay and a flexible spending account

description:

· A degree in Human Resources Management or similar is preferred. • A minimum of an associate degree or higher is required. • Minimum of 2 years of office experience in human resource/ business environment • Available to work on flexible schedule • Working experience of computer applications, including Outlook, Microsoft Word/Excel. • Experience in any HR systems or applications is plus • Ability to manage high level confidentiality and compliance • Individuals must possess excellent verbal and written & telephonic communication skills, and strong customer service skills

Responsibilities:

· Responsible for maintaining up-to-date employee and faculty hiring records

· Assist with the appointment of new hires ensuring completion of required documents, including the onboarding, required in-services, certifications, credential verification, the I-9, W-4, direct deposit forms, and background check, drug screening etc.

· Create and/or maintain electronic records/reports utilizing a variety of software applications including Microsoft Excel, Paylocity and Professional Development records.

· Assist VP of Administration on day-to-day departmental needs

· Perform office related job duties

· Accurately maintain digital and physical copies of employee records, track for expired documents and maintain all required records in current stat.

· Performs employment verifications, assist in new job postings to various department heads and coordinating the new hire interviews.

Manage recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding process for positions at all levels by creating and documenting workflows

· Assisting in IPEDS and various compliance annual reporting

· Assists VP Administration with employee communications of all kinds; may prepare materials, conduct orientation sessions, or provide updates for web pages

· Asist in annual review of employee handbook and researching in various policies and procedures set by the state and federal agencies.

. Create and maintain job responsibilities and New Hire Checklist

* Provide employee counseling and conflict resolution as needed.
* Maintain and document confidential information on all employees, records of performance improvement plan and work-related issues
* Design incentives, benefit programs for employee appreciation.
* Assist in maintaining schedules and time off calendar.
* Create faculty contracts.
* Maintain records for employees in training, schedules, and audited records periodically for compliance
* Research and update employee handbook in adherence to state and federal laws. • Assist in DEI competencies and rubric.
* Participate in various compliance committees.

. Facilitate annual trainings on Violence Against Women Act (VAWA), nondiscrimination, anti-harassment, compliance thus, enhancing awareness within the organization.

* Coordinate all aspects of accommodations for students receiving ADA-504 support services (room reservations, scheduling, proctoring, etc.).
* Conduct annual employee evaluations.
* Assist with monthly wellness activity.
* Participate in committees as needed.
* Assist in annual employee notifications, review of employee & faculty handbook and researching in various policies and procedures set by the state and federal agencies. Drafting contracts for faculty & consultants
* Act as a bridge between IT department and various departments to implement various systems for the college

title: Bookeeper
description:
Role and Responsibilities

As a Bookkeeper at Jubilee Marketplace, 145 West Street, you will be responsible for managing the daily financial operations of the supermarket. Your role will be crucial in maintaining accuracy in financial records and ensuring that all accounting procedures are carried out efficiently and following established policies. You will work closely with the CEO, General Manager, and the management team to support decision-making based on accurate financial data.

Responsibilities:

* Daily Cash Management: Record and control the daily cash for the store.
* Financial Transaction Recording: Record and categorize all daily financial transactions, including sales, purchases, and other operational expenses.
* Invoice Processing:
* Receive, review, and verify invoices for accuracy and completeness.
* Match invoices with purchase orders and receipts.
* Process and enter invoices into the accounting system.
* Payment Processing:
* Prepare and process payments via checks, ACH, wire transfers, or other methods.
* Schedule and execute timely payments by vendor terms.
* Reconcile and verify payment transactions.
* Vendor Management:
* Maintain accurate vendor records and ensure up-to-date information.
* Address and resolve vendor inquiries and issues related to payments.
* Assisted with the onboarding of new vendors and setup of the accounting system.
* Expense Reporting:
* Review and process expense reports.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and reimbursement guidelines.
* Reconciliation and Reporting:
* Reconcile accounts payable ledger to ensure accuracy and completeness.
* Prepare and maintain reports on accounts payable activities.
* Assist with month-end and year-end closing processes.
* Compliance and Documentation:
* Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and relevant regulations.
* Maintain organized and accurate financial records and documentation.

Requirements:

* Education: In Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
* Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in accounting or a similar role, preferably in a retail or supermarket environment.
* Technical Skills: Advanced knowledge of accounting software and spreadsheets (e.g., Excel). Familiarity with point-of-sale (POS) systems is a plus.

· Produce work with a high level of accuracy.

* Organizational Skills: Excellent organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks accurately and on time.
* Attention to Detail: High level of precision and attention to detail in handling numbers and financial documents.
* Communication: Good communication skills and the ability to work as part of a team.

Additional Notes:

* During the Period of learning session, Pay structure will change until the person is fully trained as a Bookkeeper.
* Person will start as hourly at $18 per hour for 1 month and half as a trainee. After that, it will bump up to $20 per hour. After 3month from the hired date, once the person is fully ready as a bookkeeper, it will become a Daily salary employee as $1300 per week.

Pay: $1,300.00 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid sick time
* Paid training

* Office

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

title: Sales Associate
description:
**About us**  
Zara offers the latest fashion trends for women, men and children. An international brand with stores in the main cities of the world and online. Our business model is centered in our customers, constantly adapting to their needs. We love what we do. Teamwork, passion, curiosity, diversity, sustainability, creativity and humility are our daily motivation. Does it sound like you? Maybe you are a Zara person.

**How we imagine you**

You are passionate, curious, motivated and dynamic, with something different to contribute. You are a multitasker, creative, unstoppable and proactive.  
You love fashion and celebrate self-expression. You shine in a fast-paced environment, where you can be yourself around talented people like you!  
Having previous retail experience is a plus, but what we care most about is that you want to learn and grow with us. At Inditex you will find more than a job.

**What we expect from you**

From day one you'll work on a team and have your own voice. You’ll develop your skills and be given responsibilities. You’ll have all the tools at your fingertips to make a difference. As a Sales Assistant, part of your responsibilities will be:

* Deliver a high level of customer service
* Support the cash desk and delivery teams
* Understand the latest fashion trends
* Replenish the shop floor
* Adhere to all the health&safety and security procedures
* Support other store functions when needed

**What we offer**

In addition to a competitive salary, you will also receive 25% discount to buy the latest trends in any of our brands and a variety benefit package where you can find a wide range of discounts.  
Our internal talent is our greatest asset and we are proud of offering internal promotion programs where you will find opportunities to grow, e-learning and training programs as well as social projects to get involved and contribute to a better society, and much more!

The Diesel Fluid/Lubrication Tech. will report to our stone quarry shop in Belle Mead, N.J. and spend their shift fueling, inspecting, and when applicable assist in the repair and maintenance of heavy quarry equipment and trucks. They will have a good working knowledge of tools, equipment. The nature of the work will require that the Fluid Tech**.** be able to spot problems associated with the equipment inspections. Fluid Tech**.** will demonstrate initiative, responsibility, have good interpersonal skills and be flexible/adaptive to a fast-paced and fluid business environment.

**Company Description**

Grow with us! The Silvi Group Companies have been working on expanding our “A” Team of employees since 1947! Our team has grown to 12 companies employing over 600 employees at 24 locations across New Jersey and eastern Pennsylvania Silvi is large enough to provide the stability you need, but small enough that you can feel your individual contribution to our success. We value the fresh ideas and perspective of each new member of our team.

Our employees contribute directly to our aggressive growth and we enjoy giving back by developing our employees with professional opportunities as well as a comprehensive benefits package. Our benefits includes excellent medical (health, Rx, dental, vision), personal time (vacation, sick, holidays) and a retirement package that not only includes a 401K plan but an almost extinct pension plan as well. We protect our employees’ futures by providing no cost disability and life insurance coverages with the option to purchase additional coverage as per their family's needs. Our close knit environment develops a culture in which we work hard but get to know each and every employee that helps us build our future. If you are driven, creative, and want to see your contributions reflected in real time, come work for us!

**Position Essential Functions Responsibilities**

* Check oil, grease and fuel trucks and heavy equipment daily.
* Check coolant levels, transmission levels, hydraulic oil levels, & engine oil levels
* Fuel all equipment daily
* Power wash radiators
* Report any issues found to mechanic on duty
* Perform tire inspection and tire inflations on all equipment at location.
* Change tires.
* Assist the mechanic with preventative maintenance for heavy-duty diesel vehicles and equipment.
* Assist the mechanic with driver write up’s
* Maintain a safe and professional working environment.
* Uses, stores, records, safeguards and properly uses equipment, materials, parts and other supplies.
* Maintain shop and work area in a clean and organized manner.
* Fill out fueling sheets with mileage and hours daily
* Prepare reports and records of time spent, materials, parts used and work completed.
* Complete work assignments in the allotted time frame

**Qualifications**

* Successful completion of training in automotive technology at an accredited school and/or the equivalent experience as a mechanic in the repair of motorized vehicles and equipment preferred
* Able to work second shift.
* Ability to work independently.
* Ability to read and understand maintenance and parts manuals, and other written instructions related to the maintenance and repair of motor vehicles and equipment.
* Knowledge of safety regulations, i.e. OSHA, MSHA, DOT as they apply to the operation preferred.
* Possesses a sense of urgency and ownership

**Physical Demands**

* Use hands to handle, control, or feel objects, tools, or controls.
* Stand for long periods of time.
* Kneel, stoop, crouch, or crawl.
* Hear sounds and recognize the difference between them.
* Make quick, precise adjustments to machine controls.
* Use fingers to grasp, move, or assemble very small objects.
* Make fast, repeated movements of fingers, hands, and wrists.
* Use one or two hands to grasp, move, or assemble objects.
* Use muscles to lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects.
* Use stomach and lower back muscles to support the body for long periods without getting tired.
* Bend, stretch, twist, or reach out.
* Move two or more limbs together (for example, two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm) while remaining in place.
* Hold the arm and hand in one position or hold the hand steady while moving the arm.
* See details of objects that are less than a few feet away.
* Use muscles to jump, sprint, or throw objects.
* Use muscles for extended periods without getting tired.
* Be physically active for long periods without getting tired or out of breath.
* Determine from which direction a sound came.
* See differences between colors, shades, and brightness.
* Quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out.
* Focus on one source of sound and ignore others.
* Lift 50 pounds regularly

No smoking is permitted on or within company property, including inside trucks, buildings, or anywhere on the premises.

**Benefits**

Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision, Pension, Short and Long Term Disability, Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, Competitive Pay, Overtime

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description:
**About Us:**

Headquartered in Jersey City, New Jersey, Lotto.com is the first digital platform for ordering official state lottery draw and scratch games on both mobile and web-based platforms. Lotto.com helps the lottery contribute incremental funds to state-run programs across education, parks, emergency responders, veterans' health, and other important services. With a customer base exceeding 2 million, we are currently available in ten states, with ambitious plans to extend our presence to more states in the near future.

In line with our commitment to revolutionizing the lottery landscape, we prioritize fostering career development. At Lotto.com, we offer hybrid opportunities for some of our roles, providing a flexible work environment. We aim to create a space where you can truly grow, both personally and professionally, contributing to a dynamic and forward-thinking workplace. In addition, we offer competitive compensation packages to recognize and reward your skills and contributions.

**What you'll do:**

* Create engaging and visually appealing graphics for various digital platforms as well as internal communications and documentation.
* Develop design concepts and layouts for promotional materials, such as banners, email campaigns, and online advertisements.
* Assist in the creation of marketing and company materials, including presentations, brochures & more.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure designs align with the company's brand identity and messaging.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and industry best practices.
* Assist with image + video editing as needed.

**What you need:**

* Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, or relevant experience.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and Microsoft Suite (Powerpoint, Word).
* Strong understanding of design principles, color theory, and typography.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to adapt to shifting priorities and handle multiple wide-ranging tasks.
* Portfolio demonstrating strong design skills and creativity.

**What’s nice to have:**

* Experience in the online gaming or lottery industry.
* Knowledge of video editing and photography is a plus.

**What We Offer:**

* Full-time position
* Competitive salary
* Performance-based bonuses
* Future equity in the company
* Awesome working environment
* Paid time off
* Health benefits
* Team events

title: Girl Experience Manager (STEAM)
company: Girl Scouts of the Jersey Shore
description:
**Company Overview**

With offices and camps in Farmingdale, Toms River and Waretown, Girl Scouts of the Jersey Shore serves approximately 12,000 girls and adults in Monmouth and Ocean counties. Girl Scouts is the world’s preeminent leadership development organization for girls, building girls of courage, confidence, and character, who make the world a better place.

**Position Summary**

The Girl Experience Manager (STEAM) manages, develops and executes all aspects of STEAM program development for Girl Scouts of all levels. This position will work collaboratively across the entire organization and will support the implementation of STEAM programming across departments including program, membership/recruitment and beyond. The Girl Experience Manager will deliver programming using a variety of resources, including the council’s Mobile STEAM vehicle: Innovation Station.

**Essential Job Functions**

· Develops, delivers and evaluates quality STEAM programs and resources for girls; including but not limited to one day events, badges, cybersecurity programs, robotics programs, volunteer trainings and other grant-funded opportunities.

· Identifies available resources to meet department program goals

· Ensures that program activities reflect identified needs and interest of girls and the philosophy of Girl Scouting including quality GSLE based activities and ensure STEM programs are centered around the Girl Scout programmatic pillars, aligned with the national programmatic strategy.

· Aide in guiding development of the programmatic strategic framework to drive intentional growth and a yearly planning process around key goals and objectives that promotes an increase in performance around STEM Programs and member retention.

· Operate GSJS’s Mobile STEAM vehicle: Innovation Station, developing strategies to increase STEAM programming in underserved communities.

· Plan, design and implement innovative recruitment and retention strategies with the Recruitment Department that are relevant to intended audience

· Determine the need for additional organizational support by assessing community needs

· Coordinate information about programs for GSJS publications according to council deadlines.

· Review reports and monitor trends in girl programs

· Prepares and monitors budget, work plans and goals for programs and events for review and approval by supervisor

· Maintains and updates records in salesforce in a timely manner

· Perform other duties as assigned.

**Skills & Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s Degree and/or 5+ years’ equivalent experience with community, organization, and/or marketing.

· Minimum 3 years of experience in education, STEM fields, developing and carrying out community -based programs, event and volunteer management, and/or working with youth.

· Experience designing and facilitating curricula for grades Kindergarten – 12th .

· Spanish and/or Portuguese speaking preferred

· Must be able to commit to a flexible work schedule, including evenings and weekends, and travel throughout Monmouth and Ocean Counties

· Willingness to learn new content areas including simple robotics, engineering, coding, and computer science.

· Demonstration of initiative, flexibility, and resourcefulness in working effectively on multiple projects

· Belief in and commitment to the principles of the Girl Scout movement.

· Must have a valid NJ Driver’s License and proof of insurance.

· Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

· Ability to function well in a high-paced environment.

· Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

· Thorough understanding of Company’s products and/or services.

· Ability to be flexible and open to change.

· Ability to accept criticism and work well under pressure.

· Experience identifying problems and implementing innovative solutions.

· Be or become a registered member of the Girls Scouts of the Jersey Shore.

**Physical Requirements**

· Ability to lift, carry, and transport up to 35 pounds.

· Frequent sitting, standing, walking, bending, and twisting upper body.

· Frequent periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

· Continuous indoor and outdoor activities and exposure to weather, florescent and sun light.

· Must be able to travel with Monmouth and Ocean counties.

**Equal Opportunity Employment**

Girl Scouts of the Jersey Shore is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive equal consideration for positions without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, nationality, ancestry, age, sex (including pregnancy and harassment), marital status, domestic partnership or civil union status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, atypical hereditary or blood trait, genetic information, veteran or military status, mental or physical disability, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

title: Process Support Specialist
description:
**Company Description**  

With over 100 years of experience, Sika is a worldwide innovation and sustainability leader in the development and production of systems and products for commercial and residential construction, as well as the marine, automotive, and renewable energy manufacturing industries. Sika has offices in over 100 countries with over 300 manufacturing facilities and more than 33,500 employees worldwide. With annual sales of 11.5+ billion dollars in 2022, our commitment to quality, innovation, and the environment as well as putting our customer’s needs first, encompasses why Sika is the global leader in our industries.

 **Job Description**  

The Process Support Specialist will enhance our Customer Service team by leveraging expertise in Sika’s products, policies, and procedures. In this role, you will be pivotal in providing exceptional support to our customers and internal teams.

* Conduct internal and external training, manage account reconciliation, process material returns (RMAs), facilitate new account setups, and assist with order processing.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, colleagues, and external partners to enhance and streamline processes and procedures.
* Apply problem solving skills to address and resolve conflicting issues professionally, confidently, and efficiently.
* Support the RSB Customer Care Team, which may include some travel to customer sites and Sika locations as needed.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's degree preferred with at least 5 years of customer service and/or Supply Chain and Logistics experience.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams); experience with Freshdesk and SAP is preferred.
* Ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time; some travel required.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to work independently in a proactive, solution-oriented mindset.

  

**Additional Information**  

Competitive Benefits: Health Insurance, 401k with company match, year-end profit-sharing bonus, paid time off, and paid holidays.  

Meaningful Work: Sika products enhance our surroundings and the work every employee completes helps positively impact daily lives by making our world stronger, more durable, and more reliable – every day.  

Company Culture: Sika centers work culture around entrepreneurship where individuals have the power to make decisions, learn from mistakes, and define their career.


Community Involvement: Sika takes active roles in our community and aims to support volunteer work and charitable endeavors across the United States through rebuilding and giving back.

As an equal opportunity employer Sika will consider all qualified applicants without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national or ethnic origin, or other protected characteristics.

title: Market Risk Manager
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

* Financial Risk and Governance's ("FR&G") mission is to provide effective and efficient identification, measurement, monitoring and control of market, liquidity & Stress Testing related to the clearing and settlement processes, its members and the markets. In addition, FR&G provides critical governance and quality assurance capabilities for key risk functions that are designed to meet meticulous organizational and regulatory standards. FR&G works under delegated authority from the Board and senior management to manage these risks within defined risk tolerances, as approved by the Board and senior management. FR&G collaborates closely with Quantitative Risk Management and the Counterparty Credit Risk teams to maintain an integrated and comprehensive approach to financial risk management to support an effective second line of defense. FR&Gs prime directive for applicable clearing agencies and joint ventures consists of the following:
* Maintain sufficient collateral to cover any losses associated with the liquidation of any defaulting member or family portfolio under extreme but plausible scenarios;
* Ensure that sufficient liquidity resources are available so that each entity is able to settle all transactions as contracted in the event of a failure by the single largest member or family under extreme but plausible circumstances;
* Exercise continuous improvement of policies, procedures and processes that support robust, ongoing member surveillance and effective but appropriate response to distress events; and
* Manage FR&G to maintain a deep and broad product knowledge and risk framework to effectively measure and manage market, liquidity and credit risks.
* Being a member of the Fixed Income Clearing Corporation (FICC), the Market Risk Manager foris responsible for the monitoring of daily margin calculation and managing market and liquidity risk exposures arising from trade execution and settlement activities in the clearing corporations and the depository. Responsibilities also include driving new business initiatives, leading all aspects of risk systems design and continuous improvements, compliance with Risk Management policies and procedures. Responsible for understanding of margining methodologies, keen understanding of financial markets and client profiles, and effectively collaborate with other teams to identify, analyze, and mitigate potential risks and safeguard financial market in which plays a pivotal role.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Lead a team of market risk associates and analysts across global offices.
* Review, evaluate and sign off on a daily work and other deliverables to ensure quality, accuracy and timeliness of work performed.
* Proactively identify and evaluate change in member’s market risk exposures, liquidity needs and settlement obligations and provide solutions to mitigate exposures in timely manner.
* Monitor market conditions and economic trends to anticipate potential risks and their potential impact on members’ margin requirements.
* Mitigate risk by ensuring adherence of the processes to the policies and procedures, identifying potential model, report errors, and demonstrating strong ethical behavior.
* Manage issues arising from internal audits, regulatory exams, and risk assessment, collaborate with partners to develop and implement remediation plans.
* Work on projects and process enhancements to effectively mitigate emerging risk in support of new and existing products.
* Mitigates risk by following established procedures and monitoring controls, spotting key errors and demonstrating strong ethical behavior

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of 8 years of related experience.
* Highlights the expected benefits of new actions and strategies to help others overcome fears of change.
* Fosters a culture where honesty and transparency are expected.
* Proactively seeks feedback from others on his/her own performance.
* Ensures that regular feedback is given in a constructive and behaviorally oriented manner.
* Supports an environment where individuals are respected for their contributions.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Life insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Financial Services: 10 years (Required)
* Fixed Income (treasuries, mortgage-backed securities): 8 years (Preferred)
* Strong Excel skills (formulas; pivot tables): 8 years (Preferred)
* Strong risk management fundamentals: 10 years (Preferred)
* clearing house: 5 years (Preferred)

title: Account Manager - School Partnerships
description:
**Account Manager (School Partnerships): NYC/Tri State** 

Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with Braintrust Tutors, the most dynamic and fastest-growing high impact tutoring provider? We're on the lookout for a high-octane, passionate individual to fill the role of Account Manager. This position allows working remotely but requires the candidate to be based in New York City or the surrounding Tri State areas and up to 50% travel into NYCPS schools.

**About Us:**

At Braintrust Tutors, we're not just about education; we're about empowerment. We believe in unlocking the full potential of every student, providing them with the tools they need to succeed academically and beyond. With our unique approach to lasting educational gains, we're making waves in education and transforming the lives of K-12 students everywhere!

**The Opportunity:**

As the NYC based Account Manager, you'll be at the forefront of our mission to revolutionize education. In this role, you’ll have a *highly unique opportunity to work directly alongside our CEO & Co-Founder*, working together to conquer the largest school district in the country (NYCPS).

Job Type: Full-Time Exempt

Salary Range: $80,000-$90,000

**What You'll Do:**

* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders within the NYC Department of Education (NYC DOE).
* Leverage existing NYC DOE relationships to facilitate the successful implementation of high-dosage tutoring programs.
* Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through effective communication and problem-solving.
* Drive the renewal of contracts and expand business opportunities to other schools within the NYC DOE.
* Monitor and report on the effectiveness of tutoring engagements, making recommendations for improvements as needed.
* Collaborate with internal teams to align tutoring services with the specific needs of NYC DOE schools.
* Participate in meetings and presentations with NYC DOE officials to showcase the value of the tutoring programs.
* Stay informed about changes in educational policies and practices within the NYC DOE that may impact tutoring services.
* Provide exceptional support and guidance to both our tutors and partner schools, helping them make the most of our unique solutions.
* Act as a champion for our company and brand, advocating for the unique value we bring.
* Stay ahead of industry trends and developments, continuously seeking opportunities for growth and improvement while learning directly from the best!

**What We're Looking For:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Education, Business, or a related field**.**
* A minimum of three (3) years experience in a Customer Success/Account Management position
* Must have expertise working with the NY DOE as a vendor and has deep understanding of the NYC DOE and its operations
* A driven, enthusiastic individual with a positive attitude and a love of NYC, who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust and comfort in taking a leadership role with school leadership.
* Commitment to customer satisfaction and the ability to drive business growth.
* Excellent organizational skills, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering results.
* A high degree of proficiency in customary productivity tools (e.g., Word/Docs, Excel/Sheets, Notion, Hubspot, etc.) and a willingness to embrace new technologies.
* Flexibility and adaptability, with a passion for tackling new challenges and opportunities.

Braintrust Tutors is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment that welcomes and celebrates diversity.

title: Management Trainee (Bilingual) wanted in Flushing
description:
99 Ranch Market is Now Hiring for Management in Training for East Coast stores!!

99 Ranch Market is one of the largest Asian supermarket chains in the United States, with over 70 store locations in California, Nevada, Texas, Washington, Oregon, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, Virginia and more to come! We are passionate and honored to shape the Asian Supermarket culture within the grocery industry. As 99 Ranch Market continues to expand, we currently have new positions open for talented and hard-working people. We welcome new members to join and grow alongside the family!

After the training period, qualified candidates will be directly assigned to a store and be responsible for the corresponding department SOP, product knowledge, planning, ordering, organization, employee management and all other supervisory duties.
* Manage the department's daily operation and meet the company standards.
* Work with the store management team to design store promotion plans and meet sales targets.
* Maintain product display, ensure freshness, and keep shelves fully-stocked.
* Order products based on on-hand inventory, promotion events, and delivery schedule.
* Receive poultry shipments and examine the quantity and quality.
* Control inventory movement (FIFO), including rotating product display, organizing freezer and cooler and directing physical inventory count.
* Familiar with local vendors and popular local products.
* Able to use label updating and price sign printing computer programs efficiently.
* Provide schedules to department employees and manage attendance.
* Work on Human Capital Management, including coaching, operational training, mentoring and performance review.
* Maintain a safe and clean workplace.
* Perform other duties as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* One years of experience related to the management field or equivalent combination of education and background experience.
* Work in an environment with varying temperature and use equipment.
* Require lifting up to 25+ lbs objects and including long periods of standing.
* Can work with flexible schedules such as night shifts and work on weekends & holidays; can relocate if necessary.
* Capable of reading, analyzing, interpreting technical procedures and training materials.
* Able to speak, write, present, communicate, and respond to information and questions.
* Great interpersonal skills to handle sensitive and confidential situations and documentation.
* Calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, proportions, percentages, area, mass and volume.
* Familiar with inventory management programs, Microsoft Office, IT retail, or SAP are highly preferred.
* Commit to company values and customer services.
* Ability to multitask in a fast-paced setting.
* Take initiative to accomplish goals, detail-oriented and organized.

* Authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.

**Benefits:**

* 401(k).

* Employee discount.
* Paid Time off

title: Production Artist
description:
NOTE - this is an **IN-HOUSE position at our Deer Park, NY studio only**. We're sorry, we can not consider remote applicants for this position.

We're looking for entry-level production artists to work for our two growing businesses at our Deer Park, New York studio.

Our studio creates high-quality licensed Star Wars and Indiana Jones collectibles, makes sculpture and theme park props, and also restores original movie props and costumes. Visit www.TomSpinaDesigns.com and www.RegalRobot.com to learn more about what we do. There is always something interesting happening, and you'll be surrounded by cool movie stuff every day.

This is an ENTRY LEVEL position. Experience is a plus but a great attitude and a little skill (in particular with painting miniatures or resin model-making work) will go a long way and you can expect to learn a lot in your time here.

**Our ideal candidate** is someone with hustle, flexibility and a positive attitude.

**This is a product production position, and responsibilities may include:**

* Painting of figurines and prop parts
* Hand paint and airbrush work
* Molding and casting of simple resin parts
* Cleanup (sanding/seaming) of resin parts
* Cleaning/prepping 3D printed parts (training will be provided)

This is a position for someone who understands deadlines, works well with others and doesn’t mind getting their hands dirty. Responsibilities would include production molding/casting/painting of Regal Robot products, and all-around fx style grunt work of all kinds for both companies. It won’t be glamorous work, but the studio is ALWAYS filled with interesting movie stuff… and certainly interesting people.

We are a small team looking for someone who can work well with a diverse group as well as independently. It's a fast paced, casual atmosphere with a fun, creative crew. Responsibilities may shift over time and we're a small shop where everyone is expected to pitch in as needed.

**Ideal candidates should have:**

* An ability to focus, hustle and meet deadlines
* Excellent communication skills and a positive attitude
* Flexibility and a willingness to incorporate notes into your work
* Experience in painting or model-making is a big plus, but not required.

**Some benefits include:**

* Company matched-IRA retirement plan
* Paid Vacation/Personal Days
* Paid Sick days and NYS paid family leave
* Bonus pay
* Growth within the company, annual reviews with merit raises

Our normal hours are Mon-Friday, 10am-6pm. Pay will be determined by experience, skill and expertise in the areas we need.

If you are interested please apply with a resume (and portfolio if you have any art/model-making samples) and let us know why you would be a good fit for our team. Thank you for giving this a look and we look forward to hearing from you!

Job Type: Full-time

title: Controller
description:
**CONTROLLER – PART TIME**

**Must be based in the New York City Area** 

**About Us**

Confluence Philanthropy is a nonprofit, membership-based network of 260 foundations, high-net-worth families and their financial advisors representing a combined $4 trillion in assets under management. Our mission is to transform the practice of investing by aligning capital with our community’s values of sustainability, equity, and justice.

We are a passionately committed, tight-knit team of twelve who value working in collaboration, honoring each other’s commitment to well-being, and practicing mindfulness in our working dynamics. As a small team, we are intentional about cultivating a positive environment that motivates and inspires the team to work together, have fun, have genuine camaraderie and get the job done.

We value diversity of background, experience, and ideas, committing to a workforce representative of the members and communities we serve. We celebrate differences, prioritize creating a sense of belonging, and are dedicated to maintaining equitable practices throughout our organization.

**Location** 

This is a PART-TIME office-based role based in Midtown Manhattan, NY. Ideal candidates will be offered flexibility to work around 25 hours/week, with the possibility of moving to full-time with organizational growth. This is an in-office position and must be available during weekdays between standard working hours (9a – 6p). Specific days and working hours will be agreed at the time of hire. Great flexibility offered.

**Job Summary** 

We are seeking a dynamic, hands-on Controller to support the organization’s fast-paced financial operations. Reporting directly to the Chief Financial and Administrative Officer (CFAO), this role will ensure the timely completion of the month-end close process, process high-volume financial transactions, uphold robust internal controls, safeguard assets, and assist the CFAO with the development and execution of financial strategies. The ideal candidate will have experience working within lean teams as an individual contributor and one that thrives in start-up environments with rapid response, proactively managing expectations and priorities with senior leaders.

**Responsibilities**

**Financial Management:**

* Prepare and analyze financial statements and reports.
* Conduct variance analysis and provide insights to support decision-making.
* Oversee month-end and year-end closing processes.
* Manage staff allocations
* Develop, monitor and implement internal control procedures and address deficiencies.

**Accounting Oversight:**

* Maintain the general ledger and ensure accuracy of financial records.
* Manage accounting policies and procedures.
* Ensure compliance with GAAP and other accounting standards.

**Payroll Management:**

* Process payroll, ensuring accurate and timely payment of salaries and wages.
* Maintain payroll records and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.
* Handle payroll-related inquiries and resolve discrepancies.
* Collaborate with leadership to ensure accurate employee data for payroll purposes.
* Coordinate all matters associated with the organization’s retirement plan including ensuring accuracy of retirement plan contributions

**Cash Management:**

* Oversee cash flow management, including forecasting and reporting.
* Manage relationships with banks and financial institutions.

**Board and Audit Support:**

* Assist CFAO with preparation of financial packages for Board committee and full Board meetings and with addressing committee questions and requests.
* Oversight of annual audit, form 990, and other filings. This includes coordinating with external auditors to ensure a smooth and timely audit process, gather and organize all necessary documentation for the audit, and address audit inquiries.

**Requirements** 

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or a related field.
* 7 years’ progressive experience in accounting, finance, or business management
* Proficiency in accounting software such as QuickBooks Online in a must, experience with QuickBooks Online for Nonprofits a plus.
* Prior or current non-profit experience is required.
* Strong financial acumen with the ability to analyze and interpret financial data.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile work environment.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven capability to handle various tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively.
* High level of integrity and professionalism.

**Compensation**

The position is part-time, exempt, and pay range is between $60,000 - $75,000 based on experience and skillset.

**How to Apply**

Maneva Group, a woman and minority-owned national executive search firm that specializes in mission-driven searches, has been exclusively retained for this engagement. To express interest in this role, please submit your resume and cover letter to https://adr.to/c6cvcai - All inquiries and discussions will be considered strictly confidential. This position is available immediately; we will accept and review new applications until the position is filled.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 20 – 25 per week

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Behavior Technician/ RBT
description:
Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity? Look no further! We have an exciting job opening for an ABA Therapist to join our team of dedicated professionals. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with a diverse population of individuals and make a real impact on their lives. We offer competitive compensation, flexible scheduling, and opportunities for professional growth and development. Apply now to be a part of something truly meaningful!


**Company Information**



One Step Forward offers top-notch Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA Therapy) in the comfort of our client’s home by qualified, skilled and trained BCBAs and ABA Therapists. One Step Forward steps forward, to help improve the lives of children diagnosed with Autism and to help lead and pave the path for them to succeed. Our staff creates individualized treatment plans tailored specifically to the child’s needs which will include, parent training, family training and one on one instruction for the child.


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Description**



We are looking for compassionate and skilled ABA Therapists/RBTs to join our team of health and wellness professionals providing In-Home services throughout NJ. The ABA Therapist/RBT will be responsible for working with the client one-on-one. The ABA Therapist should have patience and empathy to work with a population of clients that have Autism Spectrum Disorder. The ideal candidate should have exceptional communication and problem-solving skills and a record of effective behavior modification.


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Benefits:**


* Competitive Salary commensurate with your experience
* After School Hours
* Opportunity to earn Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification and advance your career
* Work/Life Balance
* Career advancement opportunities
* Easy to use web based tools to streamline data collection and session notes
* Tuition Discounts with Partnering Universities


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Responsibilities:**


* Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions
* Work in a supervised environment by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to help implement a child's program
* Provide in-home, and community-based Applied Behavioral Analysis therapy
* Complete thorough session notes immediately after session
* Be responsive to the needs and requests of clients, their families and supervisors
* Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of work.


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Requirements:**


* Proven experience as an ABA Therapist of at least 2+ years.
* In-depth knowledge of and thorough adherence to applicable ethical codes.
* Valid driver's license with own transportation and clean driving record is required.
* In-Home Experience: 1+ years (Required)
* Excellent verbal and report writing skills.
* Calm, compassionate, empathic, and patient.
* The ability to remain composed and adherent to best practices, even when under duress.


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Experience:**


* In-Home: 1-year (Preferred)
* ABA Therapist: 2 years (Preferred)


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) Education:**


* RBT (Preferred)


**ABA Therapist / Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) License:**


* Driver's (Required)

description:
**Hand In Hand Development, Inc,** CMA is a NYS DOH approved Early Intervention Agency that provides evaluations, service coordination, and therapeutic services for children birth to 3 in all 5 boroughs, upstate and Long Island. Hand In Hand is also an approved Care Management Agency (CMA) under the lead health home of the Collaborative for Children and Families (CCF), and provides comprehensive care management, health promotion, transitional care, and family support for children and young adults from birth to age 21. Hand In Hand Development is the largest CMA in New York and is recognized as a leader and innovator in the provision of care management services.


**Salary Range:** Fee for Service range of $150-$300/case **Location: 5 Boros** **Language:** Bilingual Spanish


**Location:** Travel Throughout the 5 Boros


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**



This position is responsible for the overall coordination of services to meet the goals of the client and their families. This is accomplished by building relationships with the caregiver(s) and care team and acting as a liaison to other agencies and ensuring they receive all necessary services and implementing the plan of care. Our aim is to provide the highest quality of care management services by complying with regulatory guidelines and meeting agency standards.



A Care Manager works with children who are Medicaid insured and may have a medical and/or emotional need. They ensure the member receives proper care and assists the family by facilitating their access to services on a monthly basis.


* Assists families to plan and obtain services appropriate to the needs of the child and family.
* Completes the necessary assessments to identify child’s medical, social, educational and psychological needs. Then develops a comprehensive plan of care based on the identified needs.
* Coordinate and monitor the delivery of identified services and the proper use of resources.
* Deliver at least 2 client-centered health home services to each client on a monthly basis.
* Attends and participates in continuing education, ongoing staff in-services and quarterly meetings.
* Responding to feedback and corrections from company quality assurance in a timely fashion.
* Perform related duties as assigned by the Supervisor.
* Maintain compliance with all company policies and procedures.
* Other job-related duties as assigned.


**Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:**



Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Sociology, Social Work, Human Services or related field or a minimum of 2 years of job-related experience providing case management or medical focused care coordination services to individuals with special needs.


* Must be in-person in our Manhattan office until training is complete.
* Deliver a minimum of 2 client-centered health home services to each client on a monthly basis.
* Each case requires a monthly in-home visit and the position can be hybrid once they have a full case load of approximately 20 cases.
* Must attend all weekly in-person staff meetings.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with clients, and healthcare providers.
* Need to use electronic health record systems, databases, and other computer-based tools to manage client information and maintain accurate records.
* Strong organizational skills to help manage multi-family case load.
* Willingness to meet with families in their homes or communities.
* Bilingual Spanish/English a plus.
* Computer proficiency (MS Office- Word, Excel and Outlook).
* Valid NYS issued ID or driver’s license; must be willing to travel throughout designated areas.
* Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within the parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to travel to numerous locations to meet with clients, attend meetings and visit healthcare facilities.
* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
* Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 35 lbs.
* Must be able to talk, listen and speak clearly.
